ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 pounds fresh green beans, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
  • 1 can (10.5 oz) cream of mushroom soup
  • 1 cup sour cream
  • 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 cup crispy fried onions, divided

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). In a large pot, bring salted water to a boil and blanch the green beans for about 5 minutes until bright green and tender-crisp. Drain and set aside.
  2. In a mixing bowl, combine the cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Stir until smooth and well blended.
  3. Add the blanched green beans to the mixture, followed by half of the crispy fried onions and half of the shredded cheddar cheese. Mix until the beans are evenly coated.
  4. Transfer the green bean mixture to a greased 9x13-inch baking dish, spreading it out evenly. Top with the remaining cheddar cheese and fried onions.
  5. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the casserole is bubbly and the top is golden brown. Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before serving.

  • 1 cup chicken broth

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Begin by placing the chicken breasts at the bottom of your crockpot. Season them lightly with salt and pepper.

item.description: Experience the ultimate comfort with creamy brown butter mashed potatoes! Infused with rich, nutty flavors, these potatoes are a delightful twist on a classic favorite. Ideal for family gatherings or cozy dinners, this dish will impress everyone at the table. Save this recipe for your next meal! | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 30min | Serves: 4 | #cat1761229889885 #Easyrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 pounds russet potatoes, peeled and cubed
  • 1/2 cup unsalted butter, browned
  • 1/2 cup whole milk, warmed
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Chives, finely chopped for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Begin by placing the peeled and cubed potatoes into a large pot. Cover them with cold water and add a generous pinch of salt. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
  2. Once boiling, reduce the heat to medium and let the potatoes simmer until fork-tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain the potatoes well and return them to the pot.
  3. In a separate pan, melt the butter over medium heat until it turns a golden brown color and develops a nutty aroma. Remove from heat and set aside.
  4. Mash the drained potatoes using a potato masher or ricer until smooth. Gradually incorporate the warm milk and the browned butter, mixing until creamy and well combined.
  5. Season with salt and pepper to taste, adjusting as necessary. Serve the mashed potatoes warm, garnished with freshly chopped chives.

  • 2 ripe bananas, mashed

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and line an 8x8 inch baking pan with parchment paper.

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 1 cup chicken broth
  • 1 cup sun-dried tomatoes, chopped
  • 1 cup spinach, fresh or frozen
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • Fresh basil for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Season the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and Italian seasoning.
  2. Sear the chicken for about 5-7 minutes on each side until golden brown. Remove from skillet and set aside.
  3. In the same skillet, add chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Stir in the heavy cream and sun-dried tomatoes, mixing well.
  4. Return the chicken to the skillet, cover, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce thickens.
  5. Add spinach in the last 5 minutes of cooking, allowing it to wilt. Adjust seasoning if needed.
  6. Serve hot, garnished with fresh basil.
